intro: Mastichodendron gaumeri, commonly known as the Mexican mastichodendron, is a rare and woody shrub native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other plants such as cashews and sumacs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers that appear in the spring. Its fruits are small, red drupes that mature in the fall. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species with conservation concerns.
